comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Mistranscribed from negative, this is General Kalin "Neidenoff" (1865-1925), transliterated to the Roman alphabet from Калин Георгиев Найденов. The name is sometimes spelled Naydenov and Naidenov. He served as Bulgarian Minister of Defense during World War I. He was killed in a terrorist bombing in April, 1925, when Bulgarian Communists blew up St. Nedelya church in Sofia during a funeral service, killing 213 and injuring 500. www.novinite.com/view_news.php?id=92297 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_Nedelya_Church_assault His Bulgarian Wikipedia page: bg.wikipedia.org/wiki/%D0%9A%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BD_%D0%...

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: Interesting selection of Royal Bulgarian orders. At the throat the order of St Alexander with swords. On the medal bar, Order of Bravery 3rd Class, Order of Military Merit, Order of St Alexander, Royal Order of Merit, 20 years Faithful Service Cross, Order of Bravery and the French Legion of Honour.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
artolog: Thanks for catching the transcription error and offering more information so we can improve the record. 
Heraldic Tyger: Thanks for these details about the medals. How interesting!
